data.title: Members of the jury (Short Film Category)
data.text:
Profile

Born on the French Riviera in 1943, Michel Ocelot is the master of the French animation world who is best known for the beautiful stories and styles of his films like Kirikou and the Sorceress and Azur & Asmar. He has also worked on many theatrical productions and TV series. Kirikou and the Sorceress (1998) set the record for the highest grossing animated film in history in France and also won international praise and multiple awards such as the grand prize at the Annecy International Animated Film Festival.

Michel is perhaps the greatest example of a French animator who has succeeded both commercially and artistically.

Profile

Mitsuhisa Ishikawa, who was born in 1958, is the President & CEO of the animation company. Production I.G. He joined Tatsunoko Production after graduating from college, and then established his own production company in 1987. Mitsuhisa Ishikawa has produced a multitude of animation and game productions. His body of work includes Ghost in the Shell (1995), which reached number one on the American Billboard charts sparking the Japanimation boom, Ghost in the Shell 2: Innocence (2004), which was the first Japanese animation nominated in the Cannes Film Festivalâ€™s In Competition, and Blood: The Last Vampire (2000), which is the base for the live action film released in 2009 and Blood: the Last Vampire (2000), which is the base for the live action film released in 2009, Blood: the Last Vampire.

Profile

Born in 1960. Animated Film Director.

Director of works such as Kono Hoshi no Ue ni, Black Lagoon, Maimai Shinko to Sennen no Mahou, and the animated version of Hana ga Saku.

Special speaker for the Cinema Department and Graduate School of Film at the Nihon University College of Art. Also a member of the Japan Society of Image Arts and Sciences, the Japan Society for Animation Studies, and the Japan Animation Association.

Profile

The director Tsai Shiu-Cheng, was born in Taiwan, Kaohsiung in 1979, and grew up in Fengshan City. He was interested in painting, comics, cartoon animation, movies, and novel since childhood.

After graduating from university, Tsai continued to study animation design and create films at the Graduate Institute of Sound and Image Studies in Animation.

After graduating from the Tainan National University of the Arts in 2005, he kept working in his personal animation studio.

Tsai researched computer animation to try and find a creative balance between the conception of visual images and the constitution of the story. He always tries to propose a new creative viewpoint when creating animation images. Tsai has now devoted himself to creating original locally influenced Taiwanese animation.
